items.title: [WIP] Ildaeil: 8 CV input expander for plugin parameter
items.body:
Pretty basic for now, 8 parameters of the loaded plugin can be automated.
If inputs are connected, the expander "steals" the UI control, if unconnected, the user controls it.

Note that this is a *left*-side expander.
There has been some discussion about using the more common convention of right side.

I've made it left-side to experiment with the pattern of constructing chains of expanding modules: here this expander adds (parameters) inputs to the left, and future expanders for outputs could use the right side.

@falkTX I'm opening it right now merely for you to check the code in Ildaeil when you got some time

TODO:
- Mark the parameter visually in the UI when the expander "stole" it.
- Mark the inputs (red/green leds?) on the expander when there is a matching parameter in the plugin (to handle case where plugin has less than 8 parameters)

items.title: MSHack ping pong - after re opening a project, this module blocks sound
items.body:
steps to repro: load any noise maker module. run it through the mshack ping pong. save your project. reopen your project. notice no sound, until you open up the cardinal window.

finding this in win 10 x64 with c459ab94 (reaper/ableton)

here's a test patch:
[mshack ping pong no worky after reopen.zip](https://github.com/DISTRHO/Cardinal/files/7696127/mshack.ping.pong.no.worky.after.reopen.zip)

items.title: 32bit vst2 : certain modules cause crashes
items.body:
haven't tested them all yet but here are ones that consistently crash when trying to load them:
audible: liquid filter, eq filter
amalgamated: d'acchord
befaco: even vco
e series: cloud generator
mind meld: none of these work
vortico: vco, wt vco, lfo, wt lfo, vcf, sometimes adsr (or, it will let you load adsr and then the project will crash upon reopen. which is the case for several others)
Valley, all their oscillators and feline

seems polyphony is a common denominator.

of course no issues in win x64 (am testing this out in 32bit since i teach classes for kids in a place that still has 32bit pcs)

items.title: ildaeil: fix ImGui assertion error in debug builds
items.body:
Empty widgets labels generate IDs that conflict with the main window. 

This fixes the assertion error with ImGui in debug builds:
```
Cardinal/src/DearImGui/imgui_widgets.cpp:632: bool ImGui::ButtonBehavior(const ImRect&, ImGuiID, bool*, bool*, ImGuiButtonFlags): Assertion mouse_button >= 0 && mouse_button < ImGuiMouseButton_COUNT' failed.
```
See https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/4796 which is precisely the same issue.
More info: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md#q-how-can-i-have-widgets-with-an-empty-label

a560b372 : finding this issue in reaper (latest) and ableton 9(latest) on my win10 32b tablet.  also tested the 32bit vst2 and 64bit vst2 in 64bit reaper on a macbook pro 17" (win 10, bootcamp) and same issue with both versions of the plugin.  it's as though the plugin isn't finding the resources folder.

last 32bit version i have that works is e87f3a03 (although many modules seem to cause crashes when reloading projects)

items.title: Replacing no-derivs artwork from scratch
items.body:
Right now, "_unless the module is really essential, CC-ND is not allowed_".

It would be good if we could instead replace all no-derivs graphics with new ones, created entirely from scratch, but conforming to the same metrics and semantics. 

A few questions to consider:

- Is anyone working on this already? (So if I make anything I can coordinate to avoid clashing with their aesthetic)
- Which assets should be replaced?
- Are there some specific design guidelines, a Cardinal color palette, or simply aesthetic preferences to keep in mind?
- Assuming assets are replaced by the book - create an entirely new file that matches the metrics of the original artwork - are there any legal or moral issues to consider?
- Can it be argued that the code part of the widget library or the core modules are covered by no-derivs, or by trade dress moral rights?

items.title: Non-free Logo Policies
items.body:
What is Cardinal's policy regarding non-libre logos? 

For example, logos that are used as trademarks, or that are a person's name, and that are included with the provision that forks must change the branding. 

By nature those assets can't be offered under libre terms, but unless an asset is both no-derivs and embedding a brand logo directly, I believe it doesn't present an obstacle to forking. 

The way I personally do it is to provide my copyrighted logo as a separate graphic composited on the faceplates at runtime.

These questions are also covered by section 7 of the GPL3.

items.title: CI builds with libsndfile enabled
items.body:
libsndfile can be used by carla and ildaeil audio file support.
Currently only mp3 is supported, which is quite "meh".

building libsndfile would involve building libogg, libvorbis, flac and opus beforehand.
maybe reuse PawPaw here..?

items.title: Detect Carla binaries on Linux / macOS, warn if unavailable
items.body:
In order to prevent wasting disk space, have Linux and macOS builds use Carla from the system.
But there should be a warning in case the frontend binaries are missing.

items.title: Build and ship Carla binaries on Windows
items.body:
Otherwise nothing about Carla will work.

We can ignore this on macOS and Linux, and require Carla to be installed system-wide in there.

items.title: Disable "show custom gui" in ildaeil for file-based LV2 guis
items.body:
Carla has little hacks to support file path based lv2 parameters as lv2 guis, but this won't work in ildaeil + cardinal due to its async nature.
So it should be disabled.

Possible to test with zconvo.lv2

items.title: Add modules to Cardinal
items.body:
I thought it would be good to start a topic with suggestions of modules that could be included.

Main guideline would be to try and pick only foss modules that allow redistribution of assets to make life easy on us.
Source should be CC0, GPL3+, MIT, or BSD and assets should NOT have `CC-NC`-like clauses.
(GPL3 currently works, but module vendors should be encouraged to use more permissive license for future versions of the GPL)

First suggestion is:
https://github.com/mhetrick/hetrickcv/tree/v2 - CC0 - has a lot of neat logic/binary like functionality

items.title: Submit PR to Rack for fixing win32 cross-compliation names
items.body:
See https://github.com/DISTRHO/Cardinal/tree/main/include/mingw-compat
All the weird "Windows.h" like includes should be renamed as "windows.h". That makes it possible to build Rack Windows builds from Linux

items.title: Audio Core Module Does not provide same options as Desktop version does
items.body:
Tested version : SHA - 4a85fc8

Scenario:
Audio Control to have available audio devices that I have in normal Desktop VCV Rack 2

Expected:
To have same audio devices, sample rates and block sizes as are available on Desktop VCV Rack 2

Actual:
Only had "1-2 out", one sample rate and one  block size.

Again, I don't know the ins and out of the software, so no idea if these are a side effect of the integration or what, so just reporting. Missing HDMI support was a big one as with Rack on the large screen HDMI is what I used.
Can I assume these are meant to be provided as options given they work on the dekstop version Version ?

items.title: Search modules keyboard input produces duplicate of input key
items.body:
Version Tested: SHA builld - 4a85fc8

Expected:
Rick click to open dialog for adding module
Type "a" to see all modules starting with "a"

Actual:
Type "a" and get "aa". 

Just FYI - I confirmed double lettering was not happening on Rack2 official release.

items.title: Provide osdialog-like async calls as Cardinal plugin API
items.body:
Plugins can use osdialog to deal with file open/save dialogs.
Since we cannot use osdialog we need to replace those, but that means a new/replacement API is also needed.
We should try to get 1-2 plugins that load files to work with this new API.

Later on we will need to make a list of plugins that use osdialog, perhaps this can even be automated.

items.title: Override engine keyboard handling for async file dialogs
items.body:
Ctrl+O and others trigger osdialog stuff, which we do NOT want to use in a plugin.
So this needs to be overridden and changed.

items.title: Handle all MIDI in the processing thread
items.body:
Currently at least the MIDI out uses a queue on a separate thread, which introduces jitter and latency.
We should override whatever file in question handles that.

items.title: Create overview of source/project setup
items.body: To help newcomers to the project get their hands dirty more quickly and messing around with the code, we can create a little overview of the repository to explain where things are and why.

items.title: Allow multiple MIDI input device usage
items.body:
There are a couple of modules we can use for MIDI input, but currently only 1 at a time can be used.
Limitation comes from us needing to lock their access with a mutex, which can make it non-RT safe if not done carefully.

An array of devices that gets copied and then pointer swapped could work

items.title: Create a table for differences between Cardinal and VCV
items.body:
We should compare between the standalone of Cardinal and VCV, and its plugin variants too.
This information can be on the GH wiki since it is likely to change quickly and we might not want to keep updating a source file for it.
Not opposed to it being in the repo either though

items.title: Add polyphonic gate/v-oct/etc to Ildaeil as MIDI input
items.body:
Doing it in polyphonic mode allows a maximum of 16 notes.
This could be quite useful to drive some samplers and synths.

items.title: Create a table of modules and their licenses
items.body:
To make it easy for us and packagers to get a general idea of the license situation, we should create a document describing the code and artwork licenses for each individual module pack, and Rack too.
This needs to be a file contained in the repo/code, so if someone downloads the source code they are able to inspect things offline.

items.body:

However CV-MIDI device works nicely in case if need send a sequence to any other synth in ableton (another track in routing menu), and that's very nice!

items.title: focus issues for VST2 in Ableton Live, Bitwig and other hosts
items.body:
Hi, finally I can get it working! Cardinal Parameter is gorgeous, thank you! VST2 has no issues with template.vcv so far so it runs.
Some issues if you will:
1. Sometimes when changing focus between DAW, explorer and the plugin itself it loses focus in module browser search field. I can't even type any symbols, every time they are different then I was intented to type and all in CAPS LOCK somehow. 
2. More annoying issue than the previous one - any action with windows explorer like save, open, literally anything causes Live's crash. It seems like you said before more porting to windows issues that the plugin itself

Cheers!
EDIT: hotkeys also don't work...
EDIT2: When closing Ableton's project with 5 instances of Cardinal it hangs Ableton and got "doesn't respong" message from windows when trying close it. Seems something with RAM but I don't sure :-)

items.title: Reopening UI in Carla produces xruns
items.body:
With both the LV2 and VST3 I see up to dozens of xruns when closing and re-opening the UI.

(note that I have disabled `GLX_RGBA` in pugl)

items.title: Proper non-hardcoded builds (was: Automatic win / osx builds if possible?)
items.body: Hi! Is it possible to make some automatic fresh binaries for win and osx if possible? Please help coding\compiling noobs ;-)

items.title: Reimplement osdialog for safe plugin use
items.body:
We cannot use osdialog because:
1 - it blocks the event loop
2 - (on linux) it either calls into gtk or uses fork

Tricky part is that a lot of its API is meant to be blocking, this is a problem for plugins and a challenge to replace.

items.title: Audio modules do not restore selected device (properly or at all)
items.body:
Not sure how important since we very likely need to redo it for a "host control panel".
But until that happens we should try to fix this.
Not sure why this fails yet. The template provided in the source that I edited manually seems to load fine. stuff we save now and then load wont have the audio interface ("plugin") set.

items.title: Lockup when changing number of threads with an active patch
items.body:
Just happened to me, impressively it locked up the entire system.
Need to lower the RT audio permissions next time to try to reproduce this.. :sweat_smile:

items.title: Ctrl and Shift modifiers don't work
items.body: Used to zoom (ctrl+scroll) and scroll sideways (shift+scroll).

items.title: Low FPS
items.body:
Cardinal is slower in graphical performance compared to the original VCV Rack.
On my system Cardinal gives about 32 FPS when VCV Rack is able to reach 60 FPS without problems.
My GPU is Vega 8 (integrated into AMD Ryzen 7 5700G), running on Linux.

items.title: VCA-1 produces visual glitches
items.body:
Not sure if issue with VCV or Cardinal.
But having this module on the board makes the entire plugin window green.
Moving VCA out of the way mitigates the issue.
Seems like the module is not closing/stopping a drawing operation properly, so the green used for its bars gets set for all modules.

items.title: Host parameters plugin module
items.body:
We should fetch some plugin parameters from the plugin/host into usable CV signals.
Likely needs interpolation to make them less stepy.

items.title: Host time plugin module
items.body: We should convert the time information from the host into usable CV signal.

items.title: Hide some menu entries
items.body:
To hide:

- [x] File->quit if not standalone
- [x] View->framerate (not applicable in plugins)
- [x] View->fullscreen (not applicable in plugins)
- [x] View->hide cursor while dragging (not supported)
- [x] Engine->samplerate (not applicable in plugins)
- [x] Library (not applicable for Cardinal)
- [x] Help->open user folder (not applicable for Cardinal)
- [x] Help->check for updates (not applicable for Cardinal)

items.title: Backspace key generates garbled input
items.body: Should be simple, leaving ticket here so I dont forget.

items.title: Implement state save/load
items.body:
We need to see the best way to do this.
Perhaps just give the whole vcv zst compressed file as chunk.
Might need DPF API tweaking

items.title: Implement MIDI driver
items.body: Shouldn't be difficult now that we got audio working.

items.title: Knobs and sliders do not update
items.body: They are stuck in their initial position somehow

items.title: Project related news (was: Gathering interested people)
items.body:
Leave a comment if you want to help.
This does not do anything yet besides building VCV sources, I need to do some experiments for it first to see what is the best approach.
Seems that we only need to create a variant of https://github.com/VCVRack/Rack/blob/v2/adapters/standalone.cpp for plugins, and then add in some hardcoded module for IO (audio, midi and transport sync)
